meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly manner.
meanings.sent1: Tom chickened out of the haunted house tour.
meanings.sent2: She chickened when faced with the barking dog.
meanings.sent3: The little chickened at the sight of a tiny spider.
meanings.sent4: His courage chickened away like a frightened bird.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest made him chickened and run back home.

meanings.definition: To back out or withdraw from a commitment or challenge.
meanings.sent1: They chickened from the dare at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: I chickened from the responsibility due to fear.
meanings.sent3: The team chickened from the championship match unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination chickened away like a scared rabbit.
meanings.sent5: The pressure made him chickened and avoid the difficult task.
